frame.name: History
frame.definition:
<def-root>A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given <fen>Topic</fen>.
<ex>And that is where the <t>history</t> <fex name="Topic">of art</fex> begins.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject about which the history is given.
<ex>The role of the Byzantine Empire in <fex name="Topic">European</fex> <t>history</t> is not understood by all.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> is (a characterization of) the type of event that is to be included in consideration of the <fen>Topic</fen>'s history.
<ex>Elizabethan Stage remain classics of <fex name="Domain">literary</fex> <t>history</t>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: End_time
FE.definition: <def-root>The end of the span of time during which the <fen>Topic</fen> occurs. </def-root>

FE.name: Start_time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The beginning of the time span over which the <fen>Topic</fen> occurs.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time_span
FE.definition:
<def-root>The span of time over which the events related to the <fen>Topic</fen> take place.
</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen>, often expressed in calendric units, of the history of the <fen>Topic</fen>.
</def-root>

lexUnit.name: history.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the sum of events associated with a given topic
